div.p:
"In partnership with the community, we will make the most of every day for every student by empowering them with the skills, knowledge, values and opportunities to thrive."
-- Mr. Richard Stokes, Superintendent

a.title: Click Here to View All News

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Registration for Fifth-graders Promoting to Sixth Grade

a.title: Registration for Fifth-graders Promoting to Sixth Grade

div.a: Registration for Fifth-graders Promoting to Sixth Grade
div.div: The Carson City School District would like to remind parents and families with fifth-graders, that registration information for sixth grade at Eagle Valley will be included in the educational packets their students will receive from their individual elementary schools Tuesday, April 21. Additionally, an email with informational links and videos will be sent to all parents of prospective Carson Middle School sixth graders, Monday, April 27.
div.a: Read More about Registration for Fifth-graders Promoting to Sixth Grade

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Schools Find Ways to Connect with Students Amid Closures

a.title: Schools Find Ways to Connect with Students Amid Closures

div.a: Schools Find Ways to Connect with Students Amid Closures
div.div: Many teachers and individuals with the Carson City School District are finding innovative ways to connect with students and families during mandated school closures from the COVID-19 pandemic. From encouraging online videos from principals and staff to thoughtful messages pressed into the fences at school sites, educators are finding ways to instill some hope, security and stability in a very fluid and volatile environment.
div.a: Read More about Schools Find Ways to Connect with Students Amid Closures

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Virtual Nod for Prom and Prom Candidates

a.title: Virtual Nod for Prom and Prom Candidates

div.a: Virtual Nod for Prom and Prom Candidates
div.div: Carson High School (CHS) is helping seniors participate in what they are calling a virtual nod for prom and prom candidates this weekend. Saturday, April 4, was the previously scheduled evening designated for what many considered a rite-of-passage for high school seniors and a quintessential American tradition that, along with graduation, often symbolizes the end of one chapter in life and the beginning of a new one. With the COVID-19 pandemic, those plans among many others have been canceled.
div.a: Read More about Virtual Nod for Prom and Prom Candidates

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Update From Superintendent Stokes: Schools Closed Through April 30

a.title: Update From Superintendent Stokes: Schools Closed Through April 30

div.a: Update From Superintendent Stokes: Schools Closed Through April 30
div.div: In response to Nevada Gov. Sisolak’s announcement this morning to extend the “Stay at Home” directive through April 30, the Carson City School District will continue with Remote Learning for teachers and students through the remainder of the month.
div.a: Read More about Update From Superintendent Stokes: Schools Closed Through April 30

img.alt: This is the image for the news article titled Carson City School District Honors Educators and Employees of the Year

a.title: Carson City School District Honors Educators and Employees of the Year

div.a: Carson City School District Honors Educators and Employees of the Year
div.div: The Carson City School District is pleased to announce individuals who have excelled in their positions as educators and employees and have been recognized for their works of merit by their peers and coworkers.
div.a: Read More about Carson City School District Honors Educators and Employees of the Year

br.br: The Carson City School District does not discriminate against any person on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability and age, and it provides equal access to the Boy Scouts of America and other designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the District's non-discrimination policies: Title IX and 504 Coordinator, 1402 W. King Street, Carson City, NV 89703, (775) 283-2130.

p.span: Mrs. Tasha Fuson, Associate Superintendent Educational Services
Dr. Jose Delfin, Associate Superintendent Human Resources
